metadata.synopsis: Jaheira and Isobel (and the player) reunite after the fight with Marcus. Jaheira is relieved Isobel hasn't been captured. Isobel debriefs with player and sends them off on their main mission for Act 2. Both of them will be in heightened mood, having just survived a fierce battle- not totally out of breath, but still recovering from the immediate battle.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Trigger Marcus' kidnapping scene in Act 2 by talking to Isobel without having first killed Marcus. Killcombat, then wait for Jaheira to find Isobel.

152.speaker: Jaheira
152.context: InternalNodeContext: To IsobelNodeContext: Relieved. If Isobel had been taken, things would be very bad

43.speaker: Isobel
43.context: NodeContext: Reassuring - Isobel's survival means the survival of the entire region, so she's saying 'I'm all good, let's worry about more important things'

34.speaker: Jaheira
34.text: Marcus has been with us since the start - they've been tracking us this whole time.

82.speaker: Jaheira
82.text: And that was no random attack - you were the target, Isobel. They know how important you are.

102.speaker: Jaheira
102.text: But they don't know about you.
102.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to playerInternalNodeContext: To player

167.speaker: Isobel
167.text: Your future is our future. Stop Ketheric, and you may find the cure to that parasite in your head.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: I haven't agreed to do anything.

68.speaker: Isobel
68.text: Our fates are entwined - more than you may realise. Ketheric's cult put that parasite in your head. There's no obscenity too vile for him.

76.speaker: Jaheira
76.text: General Ketheric Thorm. Remember that name. He's the leader of the Absolutists.

99.speaker: Jaheira
99.text: He was a Sharran, once - took to building an army of Dark Justiciars beneath this very village. Alongside the local druids, we made it our business to see him deposed - dead and buried.

165.speaker: Jaheira
165.text: But he's returned. Not only does General Ketheric Thorm live again, it seems he is no longer mortal. He has become, in fact, invincible.

86.speaker: Narrator
86.text: *Ketheric Thorm worshipped Lady Shar...? That would make him your natural ally, surely. Though perhaps it would be unwise to voice such a thought to present company...*

158.speaker: Jaheira
158.text: We met him on the road here - commanding the army of the Absolute. I put an arrow through his eye myself, only to watch him pluck it out like a splinter.

124.speaker: Jaheira
124.text: A man does not return from the dead and becomes impervious to arrows out of nowhere. There is magic at work - strong, arcane, and most likely necromantic.

0.speaker: Jaheira
0.text: He healed right in front of me, and chased us into the shadows. We took shelter here, and were considering a full retreat - until you came along.

116.speaker: Jaheira
116.text: I don't know why he's waiting, why he's not marching his army west as we speak, but as long as he remains, there's still a chance.

87.speaker: Jaheira
87.text: You are that chance. Protected by your artefact, you can infiltrate Moonrise Towers, posing as a True Soul.

112.speaker: Jaheira
112.text: Discover the source of his invulnerability. Make him mortal, so we can make him bleed. Good luck.
112.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira walks away.InternalNodeContext: directed to playerNodeContext:  directed to player

49.speaker: Isobel
49.text: We're in more danger than I knew. If something happens to me, everyone in this inn is dead. Like that.
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Snaps her finger on 'that' or does some other gesture of immediacyInternalNodeContext: To playerNodeContext: (GregRetake) too breathless and hopeless, more grim realization

107.speaker: Isobel
107.text: Pull the right brick, and the whole tower goes tumbling down.
107.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all

51.speaker: Isobel
51.text: Selûne gave me the power to protect this place, but I can't keep it up forever. Such magic, it's... draining. Soon I'll be dry.
51.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all

85.speaker: Isobel
85.text: Without me, Harpers, Flaming Fist, everyone intent on stopping Ketheric is dead.
85.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all needs more determination

48.speaker: Isobel
48.text: But now that we have you, perhaps we have a chance.
48.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Marcus told me Ketheric wanted you captured - not killed. Why?

89.speaker: Isobel
89.text: Why does a man like him do anything? Power - spite - some kind of twisted, personal morality.
89.context:
CinematicNodeContext: (GregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all
NodeContext: She's talking about her father here, though not admitting htat to the player. This is deeply personal to her.

8.speaker: Isobel
8.text: I can understand why he'd want me dead. Without me keeping the curse at bay, everyone in this inn - everyone intent on killing him - is dead too.
8.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all

26.speaker: Isobel
26.text: As for why he'd want to take me alive... I don't know. And I don't want to find out.
26.context: NodeContext: (gregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all was too casual

162.speaker: Isobel
162.text: Now that we have you, I hope I won't have to.
162.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all

79.speaker: Isobel
79.text: Let's hope your cunning is as strong as your optimism.

36.speaker: Isobel
36.text: You're the key to all of this.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: I'm getting tired of hearing that.

118.speaker: Isobel
118.text: You'll have time for irrelevance when you're dead. For now, we need you.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: I never get tired of hearing that.

139.speaker: Isobel
139.text: Good. Because your work here is only beginning.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Then you'd better find a way to stop a second attack.

145.speaker: Shadowheart
145.text: A Sharran? Perhaps someone I should seek out...

96.speaker: Isobel
96.text: I'll look after them, Jaheira. You should check on the others.
96.context: CinematicNodeContext: After this, Jaheira nods at Isobel, then looks at the player meaningfully

163.speaker: Jaheira
163.text: Remember what we discussed. Ketheric will strike again. We need you to strike first.
163.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira leaves after lineNodeContext: She needs in affirmation, but has one last thing to say to the players before departing.

101.speaker: Jaheira
101.text: If you are who I think you are, you have a long road ahead of you. Good luck. And thank you.
101.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira leaves after lineNodeContext: Jaheira to player

35.speaker: Isobel
35.text: I'm Isobel. And you're... meant to save us all, I believe?

131.speaker: Narrator
131.text: *Isobel. The same name as Ketheric Thorm's daughter - the one whose sarcophagus you found empty in the family mausoleum.*

106.speaker: Narrator
106.text: *Her breath catches; you notice a barely-perceptible shudder run through her body.*

69.speaker: Isobel
69.text: An unfortunate coincidence. I hope never to meet the wicked man who haemorrhaged shadows over this peaceful village. But you - you're different.

78.speaker: Isobel
78.text: Small inn. And it's not every day someone like you comes waltzing out of the dark.

6.speaker: Isobel
6.text: You can walk among the cult unnoticed. You can get close to Ketheric. Sounds to me like you're the answer to our biggest problem.

140.speaker: Isobel
140.text: You can walk among the cult unnoticed - which means you can get close to their leader, Ketheric Thorm, in Moonrise Towers.
140.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) was too reverant in awe of the player

31.speaker: Player
31.text: I'm getting tired of hearing that.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: I never get tired of hearing that.

155.speaker: Isobel
155.text: I have something for you - something that'll help you make it to the Towers.
155.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) too relaxed, she is equipping the player before sending them off to almost certain death

104.speaker: Isobel
104.text: Consider it a backup in case you lose that lantern.

45.context:
CinematicNodeContext: |Casts 'Protection from Good and Evil', but modified with Selunite (moon) magic to protect against the Shadowcurse specifically. Isobel can use the planned animations for this spell cinematically, or something bespoke as best fits the scene.

We see every party member  take on a moon-like effect as a result of being targeted with the spell, which then fades as though absorbed by each of them. This gives them a special in-game status to protect them from the curse|

123.speaker: Isobel
123.text: It suits you. And better than that, it'll make you immune to the lesser effects of the shadow curse, which will get you closer to the Towers.
123.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) read was too jokey. The magic she uses prior to this is very elegant, almost spiritual

77.speaker: Isobel
77.text: It won't be enough to protect you against areas of utter darkness, though - where the curse is strongest. This lantern should, though.
77.context: CinematicNodeContext: Isobel hands the player the Moon Lantern.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: A Moonlantern? Those are powered by trapped pixies, you know.

159.speaker: Isobel
159.text: We'll be sure to free them - after Ketheric is dead.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Thank you - now I must make my way to the Towers.

81.speaker: Isobel
81.text: Wait - before you head off into the shadows, there's... something else.
81.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) Too nervous and tentative. The wait sounds like shes panicked.

160.speaker: Isobel
160.text: I don't like to go on in front of the others, but... it's about Ketheric Thorm.

67.speaker: Isobel
67.text: He used to preside over this village - a good man, a respected man - who turned to darkness quite suddenly, I've been told.

5.speaker: Narrator
5.text: *There's an acute sadness in her voice. It seems she's even more invested in this story than she'd like to admit.*

44.speaker: Isobel
44.text: He began worshipping Shar and raised an army of Dark Justiciars right underneath the locals' noses. A coalition of Harpers and druids put him down - killed him and buried him in the Thorm family mausoleum.

21.speaker: Isobel
21.text: But now... he's returned. And he's invincible. Neither arrow nor sword can harm him.

146.speaker: Isobel
146.text: The darkness he's subscribed to is unlike any I've heard of. I fear there's something deeper behind it all - something neither you, nor I, nor even Selûne can fix.

138.speaker: Isobel
138.text: I found this on the wall when I arrived. It must be a hundred years old. Ketheric, before he turned.
138.context:
CinematicNodeContext: She shows us an old daguerrotype photo of two individuals: Ketheric Thorm and Aylin (Nightsong). They stand side-by-side in a somewhat austere way, rather than affectionate. Still, each has kindness in their face. Isobel was the (magical) 
photographer.

29.speaker: Isobel
29.text: This man - a Selûnite, not unlike myself - had family. Friends. And he abandoned them all to become a monster.

66.speaker: Isobel
66.text: I know Jaheira narrowly escaped his grasp. Have you encountered him yet?

91.speaker: Player
91.text: I've seen him - he was presiding over a trial. Survived what should've been a lethal blow, too.

39.speaker: Isobel
39.text: Him presiding over a court of law. What a joke. I'm glad you got out of there alive - that's more than many can say.

130.speaker: Player
130.text: I haven't met him yet - but I intend to.

12.speaker: Isobel
12.text: Brave fellow. They say there's no fanaticism like that of a convert, and Ketheric is a convert many times over.

50.speaker: Isobel
50.text: He is fickle. Changeable. His devotion is shallow but violent.

105.speaker: Isobel
105.text: I don't fear much. Not even death. But I do fear him.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I've seen him in a kind of vision.

134.speaker: Isobel
134.text: You did? How did he... how did he seem?

122.speaker: Isobel
122.text: So powerful he may be past our ability to fix this.

16.speaker: Isobel
16.text: To turn away from Selûne for this. This curse. This disgusting power to corrupt and kill...
16.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) read was on the verge of tears, try for more disgust as to what her father has done

80.speaker: Isobel
80.text: We need a champion to find the source of his invincibility and put it to an end. And it seems, my not-quite-True-Soul, that champion is you.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: I still don't see why it has to be me.

7.speaker: Isobel
7.text: Why you? It's like the gods custom-designed you to sabotage this cult - to put an end to Ketheric Thorm.
7.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) read was too dramatic too fangirly, doesnt match with following line

157.speaker: Isobel
157.text: You can walk among the cultists undetected; you can find the source of Ketheric's power.
157.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) too reverant and in awe of the player doesnt match with previous

109.speaker: Player
109.text: Somehow fate keeps leading me to the same conclusion.

133.speaker: Isobel
133.text: Perhaps there's something to it, then.
133.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) next line is "No mercy." pretty odd tone shift

103.speaker: Player
103.text: You'll be here to protect these people, won't you?

94.speaker: Isobel
94.text: For as long as I'm able. Even Selûne's light can't hold back the dark forever.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Once I take Ketheric's head, you'll be safe again.

169.speaker: Isobel
169.text: No mercy. For Ketheric will have none on you. End this.
169.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) line is preceded by several lines, first record had a major shift in tone. Treat "no mercy" as advice not a command.

164.speaker: Player
164.text: I've been over this with Jaheira. I'll head to the Towers shortly.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: Not yet. Jaheira says he's invincible - that I need to find a way to make him vulnerable.

1.speaker: Isobel
1.text: Whatever he's done to protect himself is a magic so dark I can hardly fathom it.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: Who's the woman in the picture?

55.speaker: Isobel
55.text: Everything Ketheric has touched for a hundred years has died - quickly, by violence, or slowly, by decay.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Anything else I should know before heading off?

23.speaker: Isobel
23.text: Ketheric is a frightening man. But you have something he doesn't: allies worth having.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: I'm not sure if I can trust a Selûnite.

72.speaker: Isobel
72.text: I'd say the same about you, if I hadn't just seen you fight against Marcus. I'm willing to put my doubts aside - perhaps you can, too.
72.context: NodeContext: (GregRetake) tone it down a bit, starts off a little valley girl

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Marcus told me Ketheric wanted you captured - not killed. Why?

70.speaker: Shadowheart
70.text: Selûnite magic. Dark Lady forgive me.
70.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if SH has been revealed as a shar worshipperNodeContext: Low-key revulsion

149.speaker: Isobel
149.text: I might take that badly if you hadn't just saved my neck, Sharran.

114.speaker: Shadowheart
114.text: A gaudy display. Let's just hope it actually protects us.
114.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if SH has NOT been revealed as a shar worshipperNodeContext: Distaste (while keeping her cards to her chest re: her shar worship)

98.speaker: Isobel
98.text: Only a fool would doubt the Moonmaiden.
98.context: NodeContext: Pointed. Directed at Shadowheart for making an anti-Selune statement.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: I already have a Moonlantern. I can safely travel the shadows.

75.speaker: Isobel
75.text: Well! If I'd have realised, I'd have spared the theatrics. In that case, you should be able to navigate a path straight to your target. That's good - very good.

132.speaker: Isobel
132.text: Well! Now you have two. Just in case.

119.speaker: Isobel
119.text: The True Soul who saved my life.

148.speaker: Isobel
148.text: We've met. They warned me about Marcus - just before the attack.

71.speaker: Jaheira
71.text: You were right. You tried to warn me, but I was too stubborn to listen. It won't happen again.

42.speaker: Jaheira
42.text: It was exactly as you reported. I can't believe I didn't see it sooner.

28.speaker: Jaheira
28.text: Now more than ever, you're our best hope of making it out of here alive.

127.speaker: Jaheira
127.text: Ketheric will strike again. We need you to strike first.

37.speaker: Jaheira
37.text: We need you to infiltrate Moonrise Towers - no one will suspect a 'True Soul'. Ketheric's been made immortal.

59.speaker: Jaheira
59.text: He can be unmade, but we need you to find out the source of his invulnerability.

63.speaker: Jaheira
63.text: Make him mortal, so we can make him bleed.
